heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 20 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (177°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 54.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.5°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.9 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 627 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 137.5m higher than yesterday, 319.8m lower than the past week, 627.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 642m and a high of 993m, averaging 892.4m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and near calm conditions. A few light raindrops may fall, occasional overcast conditions, and periods of sunshine are expected. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (86%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
